IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Fryeburg Academy is an independent secondary school that serves a widely diverse population of local day students and boarding students from across the nation and around the world. The Academy believes that a strong school community provides the best conditions for learning and growth. Therefore, the Academy strives to create a supportive school environment that promotes respect, tolerance, and cooperation, and prepares students for responsible citizenship. Within this context, the Academy's challenging and comprehensive academic program, enriched by a varied co-curriculum, provides the knowledge and skills necessary for success in higher education and the workplace.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Fryeburg Academy is an independent secondary school that serves a widely diverse population of local day students and boarding students from across the nation and around the world.
IRS990.Description: Elementary & Secondary Education: Secondary Education of High School Students (644)

ActivityOther.Description: The Admission department expenses and student recruitment fees paid out.
Athletics provided for the students at the Academy.
Information technology provided to the students at the Academy.
Dormitory activities rovided for the boarding students.
Dormitory maintenance and operations involved in maintaining the dorm facilities for the boarding students.

ContractorCompensation.DescriptionOfServices: Building contractor for the new Performing Arts Center

ProgramServiceRevenue.Description: Tuition from Boarders net of Contributions

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The collection consists of numerous works of art that were donated to the Academy for display at the Stephen Pace Gallery in the Performing Arts Center and at several other locations on the campus. All of the works of Art have been appraised by a noted art appraiser.
3% of the trailing 12 quarters are used to support operating expenses of the school.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Fryeburg Academy has 657 students. Our student population continues to be a mix of students from around the world (school year 2009-2010 China, Korea, Vietnam, Japan, Spain, Thailand, Taiwan, Turkey, Russia, Denmark, Sweden, Nepal and Rwanda) and students from our local communities (Fryeburg, Brownfield, Denmark, Lovell, Sweden, Stoneham & Stow and additionally, Chatham, NH and Albany Township, ME). Fryeburg Academy admits students of any race, religion, gender, national origin, or sexual orientation in all the rights, privileges, programs and activities available to students at the school. Fryeburg Academy does not discriminate in the administration of its educaional policies, admission policies, financial aid, or any other programs administered by the school.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: Fryeburg Academy is a private academy that also serves as the district high school. The Academy receives for each student educated at the Academy, the State Average Tuition, plus an Insured Value Factor.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The Headmaster lives in Fryeburg Academy housing, namely the headmaster's house.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Brother & Sister in laws both Trustees

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Fryeburg Academy Trustee and President of Chalmers Insurance Company
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Trustee is President of the insurance company of record for the Academy for numerous years.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Fryeburg Academy Trustee and owner of Sheridan Corporation
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Trustee owns the general contracting company hired to build the Performing Arts Center

OtherNonCashContributionsTable.Description: 12 Lenevo Thinkpas, Kodak Scan Mate, Computers Equipment & PDF Converter 6
Musical Instruments, Trumpet, Trombone, Kohlert Bassoon, Guitar & Amp

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: There is a trustuee to trustee relation father/son. The trustee is on the board and the father is a Trustee Emeritus. All transactions are at arms-length and Fair Market Value.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The form 990 was turned over to the Fryeburg Academy treasurer and financial committee for review.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Academy gains its accreditation from the New England Association of Schools and Colleges. They routinely inspect governing documents, conflict of interest policies, and our financial statements. The results of this accreditation are shared with the State of Maine as a requirement of our School Approval. The results are also shared with Maine School Administrative District #72 as a matter of legal contract. MSAD 72 has a local, elected public school board.
